items.name: DBPCR
items.description: PWR disable backup protection control register

fields.name: BREN
fields.description: Backup RAM retention in Standby and V<sub>BAT</sub> modes When this bit set, the backup regulator (used to maintain the backup RAM content in Standby and V<sub>BAT</sub> modes) is enabled. If BREN is cleared, the backup regulator is switched off. The backup RAM can still be used in 	Run and Stop modes. However its content is lost in Standby and V<sub>BAT</sub> modes. If BREN is set, the application must wait till the backup regulator ready flag (BRRDY) is set to indicate that the data written into the SRAM is maintained in Standby and V<sub>BAT</sub> modes.

fields.name: MONEN
fields.description: Backup domain voltage and temperature monitoring enable

fields.name: VBE
fields.description: V<sub>BAT</sub> charging enable Note: Reset only by POR,.

fields.name: VBRS
fields.description: V<sub>BAT</sub> charging resistor selection

fields.name: BRRDY
fields.description: backup regulator ready This bit is set by hardware to indicate that the backup regulator is ready.

fields.name: VBATL
fields.description: V<sub>BAT</sub> level monitoring versus low threshold

fields.name: VBATH
fields.description: V<sub>BAT</sub> level monitoring versus high threshold

fields.name: TEMPL
fields.description: temperature level monitoring versus low threshold

fields.name: TEMPH
fields.description: temperature level monitoring versus high threshold

fieldset/DBPCR.description: PWR disable backup protection control register

fields.name: DBP
fields.description: Disable Backup domain write protection In reset state, all registers and SRAM in Backup domain are protected against parasitic write 	access. This bit must be set to enable write access to these registers.

fields.name: IORETEN
fields.description: IO retention enable: When entering into standby mode, the output is sampled, and applied to the output IO during the standby power mode.  Note: the IO state is not retained if the DBG_STANDBY bit is set in DBGMCU_CR register.

fields.name: JTAGIORETEN
fields.description: IO retention enable for JTAG IOs when entering into standby mode, the output is sampled, and applied to the output IO during the standby power mode

fields.name: LPMS
fields.description: low-power mode selection This bit defines the Deepsleep mode.

fields.name: SVOS
fields.description: system Stop mode voltage scaling selection These bits control the V<sub>CORE</sub> voltage level in system Stop mode, to obtain the best trade-off between power consumption and performance.

fields.name: CSSF
fields.description: clear Standby and Stop flags (always read as 0) This bit is cleared to 0 by hardware.

fields.name: FLPS
fields.description: Flash memory low-power mode in Stop mode This bit is used to obtain the best trade-off between low-power consumption and restart time when exiting from Stop mode. When it is set, the Flash memory enters low-power mode when the CPU domain is in Stop mode. Note: When system enters stop mode with SVOS5 enabled, Flash memory is automatically forced in low-power mode.

fields.name: BOOSTE
fields.description: analog switch V<sub>BOOST</sub> control This bit enables the booster to guarantee the analog switch AC performance when the V<sub>DD</sub> supply voltage is below 2.7 V (reduction of the total harmonic distortion to have the same switch performance over the full supply voltage range) The V<sub>DD</sub> supply voltage can be monitored through the PVD and the PLS bits.

fields.name: AVD_READY
fields.description: analog voltage ready This bit is only used when the analog switch boost needs to be enabled (see BOOSTE bit). It must be set by software when the expected V<sub>DDA</sub> analog supply level is available. The correct analog supply level is indicated by the AVDO bit (PWR_VMSR register) after setting the AVDEN bit (PWR_VMCR register) and selecting the supply level to be monitored 	(ALS bits).

fields.name: SRAM2SO
fields.description: AHB SRAM2 shut-off in Stop mode.

fields.name: SRAM1SO
fields.description: AHB SRAM1 shut-off in Stop mode

fields.name: STOPF
fields.description: Stop flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by any reset or by setting the CSSF bit.

fields.name: SBF
fields.description: System standby flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a POR or by setting the CSSF bit.

fields.name: NSPRIV
fields.description: PWR functions privilege configuration Set and reset by software. This bit can be written only by privileged access.

fields.name: BYPASS
fields.description: power management unit bypass

fields.name: LDOEN
fields.description: LDO enable  The value is set by hardware when the package uses the LDO regulator.

fields.name: PVDE
fields.description: PVD enable

fields.name: PLS
fields.description: programmable voltage detector (PVD) level selection These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the PVD.

fields.name: AVDEN
fields.description: peripheral voltage monitor on V<sub>DDA</sub> enable

fields.name: ALS
fields.description: analog voltage detector (AVD) level selection These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the AVD.

fields.name: AVDO
fields.description: analog voltage detector output on V<sub>DDA</sub> This bit is set and cleared by hardware. It is valid only if AVD on VDDA is enabled by the AVDEN bit. Note: Since the AVD is disabled in Standby mode, this bit is equal to 0 after standby or reset until the AVDEN bit is set.

fields.name: VDDIO2RDY
fields.description: voltage detector output on V<sub>DDIO2</sub> This bit is set and cleared by hardware.

fields.name: PVDO
fields.description: programmable voltage detect output This bit is set and cleared by hardware. It is valid only if the PVD has been enabled by the PVDE bit. Note: Since the PVD is disabled in Standby mode, this bit is equal to 0 after Standby or reset until the PVDE bit is set.

fields.name: VOS
fields.description: voltage scaling selection according to performance These bits control the V<sub>CORE</sub> voltage level and allow to obtain the best trade-off between power consumption and performance: - In bypass mode, these bits must also be set according to the external provided core voltage level and related performance. - When increasing the performance, the voltage scaling must be changed before increasing the system frequency. - When decreasing performance, the system frequency must first be decreased before changing the voltage scaling.

fields.name: VOSRDY
fields.description: Ready bit for V<sub>CORE</sub> voltage scaling output selection.

fields.name: ACTVOSRDY
fields.description: Voltage level ready for currently used VOS

fields.name: ACTVOS
fields.description: voltage output scaling currently applied to V<sub>CORE</sub> This field provides the last VOS value.

fields.name: WUPEN
fields.description: enable wakeup pin WUPx These bits are set and cleared by software. Note: an additional wakeup event is detected if WUPx pin is enabled (by setting the WUPENx bit) when WUPx pin level is already high when WUPPx selects rising edge, or low when WUPPx selects falling edge.

fields.name: WUPP
fields.description: wakeup pin polarity bit for WUPx These bits define the polarity used for event detection on WUPx external wakeup pin.

fields.name: WUPPUPD
fields.description: wakeup pin pull configuration for WKUPx These bits define the I/O pad pull configuration used when WUPENx = 1. The associated GPIO port pull configuration must be set to the same value or to 00. The wakeup pin pull configuration is kept in Standby mode.

fields.name: CWUF
fields.description: clear wakeup pin flag for WUFx These bits are always read as 0.

fields.name: WUF
fields.description: wakeup pin WUFx flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a RESET pin or by setting the CWUFx bit in PWR_WUSCR register.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: V<sub>DDA</sub> is equal or higher than the AVD threshold selected with the ALS[2:0] bits.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: V<sub>DDA</sub> is lower than the AVD threshold selected with the ALS[2:0] bits.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Read and write to PWR functions can be done by privileged or unprivileged access.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Read and write to PWR functions can be done by privileged access only.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: V<sub>DD</sub> is equal or higher than the PVD threshold selected through the PLS[2:0] bits.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: V<sub>DD</sub> is lower than the PVD threshold selected through the PLS[2:0] bits.

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Charge V<sub>BAT</sub> through a 5 kΩ resistor.

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Charge V<sub>BAT</sub> through a 1.5 kΩ resistor.
